bow: do you ever get sick of justifying the love you have for your kids yes love that little booger monster but need time to be myself too me time does take away from loving her to death and no one should have to justify that all the time if we could just get rid of mommy guilt we all be able to live our mom lives in peace and self care what hate more is casually or jokingly say man could sure use break from these kids or any variation thereof and being met with the reply of enjoy it while you can they grow up so fast you don want to miss this time no it not enjoyable to literally not exist as human outside of being mother thanks for that guilt trip due with soon and still sending my 5yo to daycare couple days week until kindergarten begins to give me break and enjoy some alone time with the baby apparently horrible and should be with both kids 24 especially during sleep deprivation it not fair to year old to have to miss out on socializing because you are working around the nap times of baby also it really hard to go from being with mom 24 to full time kindergarten next year my kid will be and we are using some money we would rather go to savings for house for very part time preschool so he doesn have to experience being away from me for the whole school day straight away think what you are doing is really good for your year old is being with your kids really that hard stay at home dad and yeah sometimes it tiring but never feel like losing my identity or anything not trying to put anyone down here but as someone in your shoes ve had an entirely different experience just trying to understand what you all feel is missing dad and just want to say feel you work all day come home and get my girls for about hours before put them to bed between 10pm is me time im in the army and about once month have day weekend where do work but the girls daycare is still open they go the whole day because need me time like to involve them as much as possible in my life going to get haircut grocery shopping all of that but just need day to veg and feel free we ve had rough eight months four deaths in the family including my mother in law my husband who needs second kidney transplant has been hospitalized four times since july most recently on valentine day had to call an ambulance for my husband he was in icu one night but spent total of four nights in the hospital when he came home five days later that very night my son started coming down with the flu and was sick for over week even running 103 104 fever for couple of days ve been run ragged being the caretaker this last month and even somewhat prior as my husband physical condition is much changed due to his health issues my 12 year old son our one and only child is at 6th grade outdoor education camp this week now love my son dearly we waited 19 years to become parents and it happened through an adoption situation that unexpectedly came up we embraced parenting and never once looked back so while miss him terribly am also reveling in the fact that have had some down time after all the stress lately time to just sit and veg without someone talking my ear off but also admit looking forward to seeing my son tomorrow when he gets home removed yeah but *enjoy the cuddles while you can **eyeroll** wonder where the difference lies my kid is only weeks old and already feel like have lost my identity my entire day is centered around my child which love to death but who was before seems like it has been erased for everyone around me in between the breastfeeding and sleep deprivation in my job am lecturer and am used to having conversations about resent studies theories and academic prospects in my field now all conversations are about babies even from my colleagues could begin to see it already when announced to my workplace that was pregnant and slowly all topics morphed into baby stuff colleagues that used to ask me for my professional opinion now only ask about my time as mom that it know am on maternity leave but my value as an academic seems to have been replaced and that is huge part of what am friends and family has also shifted to only talking about babies even though we had vivid conversations in the past no talks on politics science or the like just parenthood wonder if people talk differently to sahds than moms or if this is just me do know if this is matter of what you do or used to do before becoming parent or if it coincides with your aspirations for what you want to do with your life my guess is that it stems from discrepancy between who we see ourselves as and who we get to be during the day yes my so is sahd and super lucky get to work from home few days week so get soooo many baby cuddles and enjoy every minute of course but each week my so tries to take her for few hours to his mom so she can visit with the baby but more importantly it means get to be home alone for hours once week look forward to it every week it so nice that he does it try to return the favor as well each week it so important to have few hours of solace— true solace and love my little one but those few hours are glorious and necessary to reset our brain whenever say that out loud to my mom she like enjoy this time theyre only little for so long like yes still enjoying my time with her while also enjoying few hours alone not going to feel guilty about liking alone time amp honestly think it important for parents to get it when and if they can hope to show her that alone time is necessary as human rant have never even thought about mommy guilt until became mother it really horrible it like even in the simplest and most menial things you do that involves your kid there will always be comments or advise coming from other people luckily there are communities like this that can help us not feel alone literally was explaining this to my husband haven had night out since my little was born months ago but my husband constantly goes to rock and laptop bath once week okay it it but now it been months and ve been needing to find myself again tired of being just mom or mama sure not alone seriously done with guilt for working way better mom for
